text: today's recipe is another one of our
fantastic slow cooker recipes it's a
Sicilian that beef stew that's by
Sicilian I mean it's flavored with
aromatic orange zest rosemary and
luscious green olives so get out your
slow cooker and let's start cooking I'm
trimming the last of about six shallots
and at the same time of browning my last
batch of three pounds of beef chuck in a
cast-iron skillet I really believe in
getting my meat browned before I put it
into the slow cooker and it just adds
that little bit of extra flavor that I
think is totally worth it so get your
meat browning and while you're at it you
can prep your shallots and any other
vegetables that you need to get ready
you're gonna need a total of two cups of
shallots and also one head of fennel we
trimmed the fennel if it's got fronds
you don't need those so you can save
them for garnish if you want to here's a
head of fennel and you want to cut it
into half inch wedges keep the core in
the hopes that maybe it'll stay together
in the pot though it doesn't usually but
you never know it could happen so get
your fennel trimmed
transfer the beef as it's brown straight
into your slow-cooker and then you can
saute your shallots add your shallots to
the pan
and give it a stir you seasoned it with
salt and pepper I've seasoned my beef
already with salt and pepper as I was
browning but I like the season as I go
along and each step of the way so the
food ends up extra extra flavorful I'm
really into browning by meat in a
cast-iron skillet because well first of
all the cast-iron skillet is a great
tool just eat really well it's a great
conductor of heat but additionally when
your meat is splattering all over the
sides of your pan and it gets kind of
black you don't even have to worry about
it but your pans already black and you
won't even notice I'm gonna get your
shallots just a little bit cook down
slightly translucent takes a couple
minutes then you add your wine it's 1/2
a cup of dry red wine to deglaze the pan
you get up all those brown bits from
browning your meat no point in browning
it if you're not gonna get every single
bit of that flavor into your stew so
scrape up the brown bits from the bottom
of your pan I promise you there there
even if you don't see huh because your
skillet is so dark and then this can go
right into the slow cooker with your
beef add your fennel a sprig of rosemary
I would say is about 6 inches long don't
overdo it because rosemary is very
intense and there's no evaporation in a
slow cooker so you want to make sure
that you have a nice balance then two
strips of orange zest I'd say about
three inches long that adds so much
flavor just for a little good measure a
little bit of salt pepper and then one
28-ounce can of tomatoes broken up pour
the liquid into the pot makes it easier
you need the liquid to
just cut them up a bit bill cook down a
little bit more but it's amazing how
long Tomatoes can cook especially if
they're already at this stage processed
without breaking down so if you don't
want to be eating big chunks of tomato
you want to make sure you cut it up at
this point before they go into the pot
okay now your Tomatoes can go into the
slow cooker cover that up add the rest
of the juices now put the cover on turn
your cooker on to high and four and a
half hours later you're gonna have an
amazing stew okay four hours have passed
I'm ready to add my final ingredient
it's a cup of green olives my preferred
kind of green olive is Castelvetrano
which is a really mild green olive they
should be pitted these have been cut off
you can also crush them and remove the
pit stir them in they just need to heat
through and the heat of the stew in the
pot is enough to do that at this point
so you just stir them in and turn off
your slow cooker and you can see that
this is a beautiful rich stew the juices
from the beef have mixed with the juices
of the tomato and made a really really
nice sauce you don't need to do anything
else but if you'd like to if you want it
slightly thicker you can spoon off or
drain off the sauce and just reduce it a
little bit on top of the stove for
additional richness but it's not a
necessary thing to do serve it with
mashed potatoes or with polenta oh ho
these are rich and then spoon it on top
makes a generous generous amount so if
you're serving for people you can make
this you can freeze some I'm spooning
your stew over your mashed potatoes get
ready to smile oh yes
I'm always amazed at how much liquid and
juices and deliciousness comes out of
food in the slow cooker all commingling
together I'm becoming one amazing
something and in this case it's an
amazing Sicilian beef stew
mmm the hint of orange there is amazing
you're gonna love it give it a try
